description: Old English āgrīsan. Compare and see English grisly.

verbs.description: agrise (third-person singular simple present agrises, present participle agrising, simple past and past participle agrised)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, intransitive) To shudder with horror; to tremble, to be terrified. [10th–16th c.]
(obsolete, transitive) To make tremble, to terrify. [13th–17th c.]
